result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua L Marchel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua L Marchel in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CM35, 16CM56 and 16CM104.

3:07 p.m.  Amended Criminal Complaint provided to the Court by the State - amended the statute number only. 
3:09 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Atty Constable clarifies the amended criminal complaint that had been provided to the Court as a housekeeping issue. 
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Drengler indicates that there was a slight change in the plea offer; Atty Constable states these corrections on the record. 
BTC:   Court grants the motion for the State to Amend the Criminal Complaint in 16CM104.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CM35:
Count 1 - DRI

16CM56:
Count 1 - DRI

16CM104:
Count 1 - Guilty 
Count 2 - Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & 2 in 16CM04 and Count 1 in 16CM35 and Count 1 in 16CM56 are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim rights notification; no victim's appear in Court today.
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
16CM35:
Count 1 - DRI

16CM56:
Count 1 - DRI

16CM104:
Count 1 -
Sentence withheld
Placed on Probation for 24 months
**Conditions of Probation:
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Jennifer Opiola-Guzman her residence or place of employment
Attend and complete the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program and comply with any recommendations.
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Early discharge if defendant complies with his conditions of his probation and his agent recommends. 

Count 2 - (amended)
Sentence withheld
Placed on Probation for 24 months
**Conditions of Probation:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Comply with conditions stated in Count 1
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 25, 2016 at 09:45 am.
